post_text:
Who are we? Let‚Äôs break it down‚Ä¶

Do you have a kid (or love a kid) that attends Spectrum Academy NSL Elementary? This is the group you want to be part of!

We have meetings, but you don‚Äôt have to come to all of them to be involved. We try to utilize all kinds of communication in order to be as efficient as we can be with everyone‚Äôs time and resources. This Facebook page is a big part of that communication.

We organize all kinds of events and activities for our kiddos, for the teachers and staff who support them, and we fundraise to get it all done.
-Welcome Back Playdates
-Class Parties
-Teacher and Staff Appreciation
-Autism Awareness
-Sensory Day
-Red Ribbon Week
-Field Day
-And so much more‚Ä¶

It takes a lot of organizing and a lot of volunteer hours‚Ä¶ And none of it is possible without YOU!

We are all busy but, when we work together, we can accomplish great things!

post_text:
This week we have Kindergarten starting. Please be patient during carpool as staff helps get them into cars. We need to keep a single file line and not go around stopped cars unless a carpool staff instructs otherwise. This is for the safety of all students as some have to enter from the driver side. We need to follow the car in front of us to get to pick up locations not go around.
We had a great week last week with carpool lets keep it up.

post_text:
Sorry we have not been super active here, we are tending and teaching kids like all of our parents are. As we teach our super students we have gained appreciation for our AMAZING spectrum staff.
This week is Teacher and staff appreciation week. We at the pto encourage you to tell your students teachers, paras and other staff just how amazing they are and how much you appreciate them and all they have done and are still doing for our students.
Our Spectrum staff have had to implement outside of the box thinking to continue teaching our students.
Send an email to your teachers, or even leave a comment below about your teacher showing your appreciation in all they do.

#spectruminspires

post_text:
As you are probably all aware the distance learning has been extended to May 1st.
We all know how hard and trying this has been. Between trying to organize online schooling for at least one student, work, aftershocks, child care parental sanity, socal distancing, quarantines, meltdowns, the works all of our nerves are stretched to the breaking point.
So to lighten things up, we want your funniest, family appropriate, memes. We will change our profile picture/cover page to the funniest meme of that day. So share away!!!!! #spectruminspires

In this time of uncertainty, we all greatly appreciate your patience.
The PTO will not be holding any in-person meeting until school is back in session. We will be doing an online meeting once more details come out from our administration.
As for the school, please do NOT take your children to school tomorrow. Administration or office staff will contact everyone with details tomorrow, after a plan of action is in place.
Again thank you for your patience!!

post_text:
In all seriousness, please do not send your sick child to school. There have been numerous cases of Influenza A and B, it is the season.
We are all working parents, and it is very hard to get sick time when our kids are sick. There is loss of hours, pay, work piles up, etc.
However, with our population of kids many have very sensitive immune systems, and get very sick, very easily.
Take the positive spin on it if your child is home sick, you get cuddles and can spend time with them that is so hard to get, even if it is cleaning up their messes üòâ. #ptolife #fluseasonishere #notmeanttobemean #havetolaugh
text:

post_text: An activity we the Elementary's Red Ribbon Week was to write (or draw) a positive message on a heart. We in turn passed them back out randomly to the students and staff. That way no matter what you had a positive message. We loved reading the notes and looking at the drawings the students and staff did. #redribbonweek2019 #spectruminspires #spectrumacademy #spectrumacademynsl #spectrumacademyes #positivemessages #thesekidsareamazing #ptolife

post_text:
Tomorrow is Halloween, please remember to have students in school appropriate costumes, no masks, no weapons, and no gore.
Tomorrow at about 9am The students will have a little Halloween costume parade, Parents are invited to watch the kids in their costumes. We need parents to please park at the church as we need the school parking lot for our amazing staff members. We will also have parents stay outside for the parade, the kids will be escorted out to parade in front of the parents.
Thursday in not an early release day, school will be released at 3:05pm.
NO SCHOOL FRIDAY Nov 1st

Thank you
ES PTO
text:
Tomorrow is Halloween, please remember to have students in school appropriate costumes, no masks, no weapons, and no gore.
Tomorrow at about 9am The students will have a little Halloween costume parade, Parents are invited to watch the kids in their costumes. We need parents to please park at the church as we need the school parking lot for our amazing staff members. We will also have parents stay outside for the parade, the kids will be escorted out to parade in front of the parents.
Thursday in not an early release day, school will be released at 3:05pm.
NO SCHOOL FRIDAY Nov 1st

Thank you
ES PTO

post_text:
We had a parent Share this with us and asked us to share it with all of you.

EVENT DATES
Thu 7:00 PM Jan 23, 2020

VENUE
Abravanel Hall
123 W S Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA

Utah Symphony | Utah Opera offers an annual concert for children with special needs and their families. We present this concert because we know that many families cannot attend cultural events together because some special needs children may have difficulty keeping quiet in their seats. We feature the Utah Opera Resident Artists with the Utah Symphony on the Abravanel Hall stage for this special concert.

This concert is FREE but registration is required.

https://utahsymphony.org/events/2019/6942/

WARM LOVE Update:

I am here to give a current update on Warm Love numbers. We Need 280 Scarfs and Hats.

We currently have: 183 Hats
187 Scarfs.

We need 97 Hats
93 Scarfs.

Deadline is preferably Halloween, so we (The PTO) can take advantage of the 3 day weekend and get things separated and ready, But will accept until November 4th at 3:45pm (When the last PTO person leave the school)

Items can be made or bought.

We appreciate all donations that have been made so far.

post_text:
We all know that Spectrum Academy is known for Autism, but our kids are so much more than that. So the ES PTO has decided that we are going to recognize the different neurodiversities of our children. That way we can bring awareness to our Spectrum Family of the different neurodiversities, and talk to our children about them, so they understand as well.
That being said if you would like to share a different Neurodiversity your child has you can post it here, or DM us. We will not post the child(ren) who have the different diversities.

post_text:
What is the Warm Love Project? The Elementary PTO of Spectrum Academy's goal is to have a handmade hat and scarf to give to each K-3 student (at Spectrum Elementary and STARS). Our mission is to make sure that our children are warm during the cold months of winter.
What we need from you: We need hats and scarfs that are handmade (knitting, crocheting, sewing, etc.) that we will bundle together and give to our students.
When is it due by? November 1st all hats and scarves are due to the Elementary school in the PTO donation box.
What happens if you don't receive enough? We will put out the call for donations for hats and/or scarves (have to be new with tag still on it, or can donate a gift card).
Any and all work on this project counts towards your volunteer hours!! Whether it is making a hat, or buying materials, it all counts!
Thank you so much for all of your help!!
Sincerely,
Spectrum Academy Elementary PTO <3

Thank you SO much for everyone that participated in the clothing exchange yesterday and today. It was so amazing to see how loving and caring our Spectrum community is! I am so glad we were able to help so many families!
Big thank you to those who helped sort clothes, fold/put out clothes, and clean up. It was more appreciated than you will know.
This is something that we will be holding every Parent/Teacher conference, so bring in those clothes you don't need or want!
-Kathy-

post_text:
Did you know that Spectrum Academy offers PEN ( Parent Empowered Nights)? The first if the year is TONIGHT from 6:00-8:00 pm.
These are lectures that are set to help us with understanding and navigating through this crazy, ever changing world.
I went to a couple last year and came home with SO much information on how to help my child with tools I didn't know exsisted.
Extra bonus- Childcare is provided!!! They must be potty trained and independent. Plus you get FOUR volunteer hours.
What more can you ask??

post_text:
We are in need of a new Carpool Drop-off/Pick-up Coordinator! The amazing parent we had doing it unfortunately had to step down.
You would be in charge of running the Sign-up Genius to keep schedules organized, helping with training, and communicating with the ES PTO Presidency on any spots that are open. The majority of this can be done at home/online. There might be times where you would need to help, but we can work on that if the time comes.
If you are interested, please let us know ASAP.
*All of the time spent in this position goes to your volunteer hours!!*

post_text:
We are so excited about the enthusiasm we have had from everyone about our Warm Love Project!

We wanted to let everyone know the easiest way to make hats:
Buy a circular loom set. Use the second largest one and make 20 rows. Fold the 20th row back onto the loom to make the folded band of the hat. Make 25 additional rows and then cinch off the top.

If you don‚Äôt want to use a loom, just make sure the hats you make can fit a kid in grades k-3 because that is our demographic üòú Happy hooking! üß∂
text:

post_text:
If you have any hats or scarves done, please feel free to bring them in tomorrow (Thursday the 15th) during Back to School Night. Please make sure they are in a bag with your name, how many of each, and approximate hours attached or in the bag. That way we can make sure our data sheet on the project is correct and up to date. If you are wanting to donate supplies (yarn), that is also welcomed and can be dropped off at Back to School Night.

We are thankful for all the help to give our wonderful students hats and scarves this winter!

Final date when we need all completed scarves and hats is October 7th.

Feel free to ask any questions you may have.

post_text:
WARM LOVE PROJECT UPDATE:

So far, Erin Larson has made 104 scarves and 24 hats all on her own!!

We‚Äôve had some interest expressed in donating materials and some interest in helping make hats and scarves.

If you have anything to donate (materials or finished hats or scarves), you can bring them to the upcoming play dates, or feel free to message us to set up a meetup with a PTO leadership member.

Remember, our goal is to have one hat and one scarf for EACH elementary student this winter. We need 116 more scarves and 194 more hats. This guy is working on helping out, and so can you!
